settings.text:
The Benefits

Cosmelan MD is a two-step intensive topical treatment used to reduce and
regulate benign stubborn and dense pigmentation of the skin.


Most Common Uses
Reduction of hyperpigmentation caused by melasma

What to Expect During and After Treatment
Your
first appointment will be a consultation and treatment, which is simply
the application of the topical cream. I will give you all the
post-treatment instructions and products needed for aftercare. The
treatment will remain on your skin for 6-8 hours depending on your skin
type. Your second treatment will be scheduled for approximately 30 days
later.


Aftercare
You must have 7-10 days following
treatment for downtime, including no sun exposure at all. You will be
given instructions regarding the correct products to apply for 6 months.
Do not get another treatment or procedure (including peels, facials, or
microdermabrasion) on the treated area for 30 days following Cosmelan
MD application. After a few days you will notice skin blemishes fading,
and a brighter skin complexion breaking through. After a couple of
weeks, the skin will start to take on a shiny, healthier glow. Full
results are typically seen after 4-6 weeks.


Is It for You?
If you are bothered by
hyperpigmentation caused by melasma, this is the treatment for you!
However, if you are pregnant or nursing, I cannot do this treatment for
you.


The Science
Active ingredients in Cosmelan MD
include hydroquinone, retinoic acid, azelaic acid, kojic acid, arbutin,
phytic acid, and ascorbic acid. Cosmelan MD contains substances that
inhibit tyrosinase, an enzyme the skin uses to make melanin (pigment).
The retinoic acid increases cell turnover, which not only sheds the
darker skin cells but brings out new cells more quickly. Cosmelan MD
contains prescription ingredients and can only be dispensed by a
licensed medical professional.
